TopicTitle: Plane landings becoming hard and annoying

Articles.Content:
I love flying planes in KSP but usually when i try to land with my own built plane (That actually flies), the wheels tend to shoot backwards towards the engine and then sending the nose right into a dive to the ground. I tend to survive these 'landings' but this is happening every single time when i try to land with every other plane. This even happens with the stock planes that the game gives you.

Is this a known bug or mild part cross feed OR am i just landing too hard (Shouldn't be that)

Thanks

Sky

What mods if any are you using? What level is the runway?

Welcome to the forums as well!

Edited October 15, 2017 by MoarBoostersRUS

Thanks for greeting me to the forums.

It will take a bit for your posts to show since you are new moderators need to approve them after 5 approved posts that limiter is lifted. I will be on for quite awhile longer (I'm in the US) so no worries.

Just now, MoarBoostersRUS said:

It will take a bit for your posts to show since you are new moderators need to approve them after 5 approved posts that limiter is lifted. I will be on for quite awhile longer (I'm in the US) so no worries.

Thanks for letting me know

I am not sure what you are describing (pictures, videos or craft files are helpful)  but i do find that if your main landing legs are well behind the centre of mass, the plane will pitch forwards hard when the main wheels hit the ground - the impact pitches the tail into the air and as a result the nose goes down hard.

This wasn't really a problem for me though until  i started flying on Duna.

 Try bringing the main gears closer to your CoM.  If this makes tail strikes a problem, then install taller legs and/or fit a small tail bumper wheel to the rear fuselage.

Also what speed are you landing at ?   KSP aerodynamics are a bit goofy,  but there's no real need to put up with landing speeds over 50 m/s even on a space plane.

This wasn't really a problem for me though until  i started flying on Duna.

This sometimes actually happens on take-off as well

My guess is that it's likely a bug in a mod. I've flow quite a few craft all the way down the runway, slammed a few down as well at various speeds, even made a few jet cars and tried them on the 3 stages of runway surfaces with no problem in a pure stock game of 1.3.1.

even if you aren't using parts in the mod as long as it's installed it can play silly buggers with your game.
